image.altText: Muslim preacher Wissam Haddad arrives at court next to a man wearing a suit

props.synopsis: The City of Canterbury Bankstown Council says the site had been approved for use as a medical centre.

title.children: Council to shut down prayer hall linked to notorious preacher

image.altText: Man in dark clothing walks down driveway. Text box says Naveed Akram.

props.synopsis: Security camera footage captured the Bondi Beach gunmen carrying what appears to be firearms out of a south-west Sydney property on the morning of the terror attack, court documents reveal.

title.children: How investigators pieced together the plot to target Bondi

image.altText: Josh Lees at Sydney pro-Palestine rally for day of nationwide marches

props.synopsis: Three prominent protest groups flag they will launch a constitutional challenge to NSW Premier Chris Minns's new laws restricting protests in the state.

title.children: Activist groups flag challenge to proposed NSW protest restrictions

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese stands in front of a white wall wearing a dark suit and with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Under the recommendations, family of parliamentarians would be restricted to economy class flights and an allowance for three annual "Australia-wide" return trips would be scrapped.

title.children: PM recommends changes to travel rules for parliamentarians' family

image.altText: A man in a white tee and blue blazer, moustache and silver sunglasses sitting in a restaurant.

props.synopsis: Stephen Cubis hides behind a charming facade, but his former lover and friends say the career con man ruined them financially and emotionally long before he was caught up in allegations of a multi-million-dollar fraud.

title.children: Fast cars and big debts: The unravelling of Steve Cubis

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a beanie looks out from behind a steel fence.

props.synopsis: Despite US President Donald Trump's objections to the annexation of the West Bank, new settlement projects are still being approved. Some Israelis are excited, while Palestinians are left fearful.

title.children: 'This is annexation': Israel expands control over West Bank despite Trump's opposition

image.altText: CBA image

props.synopsis: CBA backflips on decision not to refund low-income customers who were charged excessive fees. Meanwhile, the RBA is assessing the need for higher interest rates while gold pushes to record high. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: CBA backflips on decision not to refund overcharged customers

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: RBA 'under pressure' to hike in February: JPMorgan

image.altText: Donald Trump puts a red 'Make America Great Again' baseball cap on his head.

props.synopsis: The release of the Epstein files followed some of Donald Trump's dedicated supporters launching a rare revolt against the US president. Here are six more issues that could also divide Republicans.

title.children: It's not just the Epstein files — these other issues are splitting Trump's base

image.altText: Nathan Lyon on crutches after the Adelaide Oval Ashes Test.

props.synopsis: West Australian fast bowler Jhye Richardson comes into Australia's squad for the fourth Ashes Test, while Victorian off spinner Todd Murphy has been named, and is a chance to play his eighth match and first on Australian soil.

title.children: Australia names Boxing Day Ashes replacements for Cummins and Lyon

image.altText: A map of Australia on Tuesday showing a cyclone in the top left and a void of any cloud on the west coast.

props.synopsis: Perth and much of WA are enduring a severe Christmas heatwave with extreme fire danger, while Tropical Cyclone Grant intensifies offshore.

title.children: Severe Christmas heatwave grips WA as cyclone intensifies offshore

image.altText: A young woman in Santa hat and swimsuit looks at the ocean under blue skies

props.synopsis: It is just a few sleeps until Christmas Day, and the weather is promising a mixed bag for Australia's capital cities. Here is what to expect.

title.children: What the weather will bring in your capital city on Christmas Day

image.altText: A man standing on a platform in a tree waves his hand.

props.synopsis: The WA government abandons plans to burn a parcel of forest that is home to a species of rare tree after a 70-year-old man spent six nights living in the canopy.

title.children: Plans to burn rare forest abandoned after man camps in tree for six nights

image.altText: overhead photo of sticks of cinnamon and three bowls containing yellow powder, fennel seeds, and round seeds, star anise.

props.synopsis: Australia's medicine watchdog has issued another safety alert for contaminated Ayurvedic medicines. So what do consumers need to know about this multi-million-dollar industry?

title.children: Some Ayurvedic medicines aren't safe to consume. Here's what to look for

image.altText: Overhead shot of a large aircraft carrier warship in the sea with fighter jets lining the deck.

props.synopsis: The Pentagon moved the USS Gerald R Ford, the world's largest aircraft carrier, to the Caribbean last month. Now, President Donald Trump is repeating threats of imminent strikes against Venezuelan territory.

title.children: World's largest warship looms near Venezuela as US warns of land attacks

image.altText: Greenland lies at a strategic point between Russia and the USA.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump appoints a special envoy to Greenland, drawing renewed criticism from Denmark and the territory's leader over Washington's interest in the mineral-rich Arctic island.

title.children: Trump sparks Denmark's anger by appointing US envoy to Greenland

image.altText: Sacked members of the Maratime Union of Australia yell abuse from behind a barbed-wire fence

props.synopsis: Our favourite podcasts of the year include tales of art forgery, a documentary about the life of Fela Kútì and a true-crime thriller about a dead body in the ocean.

title.children: The 10 podcasts we couldn't stop listening to this year

image.altText: Close up of woman hanging a rocking horse christmas ornament

props.synopsis: This is my first Christmas as a single mum where I will wake up without my son in the home. I won't be watching him excitedly tear into presents. It's not easy, but there's also some relief, writes Catherine.

title.children: The struggle — and relief — of Christmas as a newly single mum

image.altText: Three men, shirtless, on stage dancing

props.synopsis: Once December rolls around, there's nothing the minor movie studios love more than getting their most unhinged Christmas tropes out of cold storage.

title.children: Quiz: Can you pick the real Christmas movies from these unhinged plots?

image.altText: Two tennis players, one man with a cap on and one woman in yellow, shake hands at the end of a game.

props.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kygrios' match marketed under the "Battle of the Sexes" banner makes a mockery of first era-defining match between Billie Jean King and Bobby Riggs.

title.children: 'Belittling of women's tennis': New 'Battle of the Sexes' a lose-lose

image.altText: A footballer waves his hand in the air while on the field, wearing a red and black striped jersey.

props.synopsis: A historic Serie A soccer clash between AC Milan and Como at Perth Stadium in February is called off, with sanctions imposed by the Asian Football Confederation blamed for making it "impossible".

title.children: Landmark Italian league game in Perth cancelled over 'unacceptable demands'

image.altText: A greying man and blonde woman seen standing in mugshots on a striped wall while wearing orange prison jumpsuits.

props.synopsis: Authorities say Colorado funeral home operators Carie and Jon Hallford gave fake ashes to some families of the dead.

title.children: Judge accepts guilty pleas for US couple accused of abusing 191 corpses

image.altText: A seafood market

props.synopsis: Australians flock to markets, shops and stores across the country in a last-minute rush to prepare for Christmas.

title.children: Early birds get the prawns as Christmas shopping rush gets underway

image.altText: A collection of fresh shucked oysters.

props.synopsis: The Christmas oyster harvest is flourishing on the NSW south coast, but further north it is a very different story as growers face the fallout of this year's record-breaking floods.

title.children: Mixed bag for NSW oyster growers as peak Christmas demand looms

image.altText: Three puffin birds on a rock.

props.synopsis: The Isle of May is the epicentre of a deadly outbreak of the H5N1 bird flu strain which has spread throughout the globe. Scientists are warning Australia could be next.

title.children: Scientists warn deadly bird flu outbreak about to become reality for Australia

image.altText: A tent pitched near a river.

props.synopsis: Unattended caravans line a popular Murray River campsite, triggering debate over whether public camping spots are being quietly claimed ahead of the busy holiday season.

title.children: Unattended caravans 'ghost camping' at free sites spark debate over fair access

image.altText: A middle aged man in a black jacket pictured at 'The Game Awards'.

props.synopsis: Vince Zampella has died after a crash on a scenic road north of Los Angeles, according to local broadcaster NBC4.

title.children: Call of Duty co-founder Vince Zampella reportedly killed in Ferrari crash

image.altText: A peeled lychee in a hand, held over a box of fresh lychees.

props.synopsis: After season constraints and rain-delayed harvests, this summer is producing exceptional Queensland lychees, according to the wholesalers.

title.children: Christmas lychees best quality in decades despite tough season

image.altText: A man with long brown hair, a goatee and moustache wearing a turtleneck jumpber smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: The man best known for his festive hit Driving Home for Christmas died surrounded by his family.

title.children: British singer-songwriter Chris Rea dies aged 74

image.altText: Two women sitting on a bench, one in an orange shirt and the other in an Australia post top.

props.synopsis: A disability enterprise is partnering with Australia Post to deliver mail to Aboriginal town camps around Alice Springs.

title.children: Meet the Alice Springs disability enterprise delivering mail to town camps

image.altText: Aerial shot of massive oil and gas rig in the Bass Strait off Victoria

props.synopsis: The gas export industry has cost the nation dearly. East coast prices trebled soon after exports began.

title.children: Better late than never: The gas fix to a problem that should never have been

image.altText: a black 360 degree camera on a high tower

props.synopsis: New cameras using AI have been installed in southern New South Wales forests and are spotting fires before they have a chance to spread.

title.children: New cameras help spotters focus on forest fires before they spread

image.altText: Blue ski boat racing on the a river with Superman logos

props.synopsis: One past Southern 80 winner and record holder wonders if the race will ever return.

title.children: Southern 80 water ski race cancelled for second year straight

image.altText: pedastal fan next to white hospital bed

props.synopsis: Patients swelter in an Illawarra hospital ward after an air conditioning unit fails during a heatwave.

title.children: NSW hospital patients swelter without aircon during heatwave

image.altText: Man standing among christmas trees, looking up

props.synopsis: From a backyard in Wollongong to a booming farm in the NSW Central West, Christmas trees are big business for Lawrence Ranson.

title.children: Green thumb goes from a backyard business to 40,000 Christmas trees
